Html:
I'm doing my own pre-fetch routine. One of the first things I do is get the tile list so I know what to fetch. But, as I'm sure you know, that call can take a very long time if the area is large.

Is there a way to gracefully kill the call to that method? I have a cancel button in my UI but if it's sitting on that call then I can't cancel until the method has returned.
try call it in the background thread, you can modify the function to cancel it async
